turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Brrrr! She must be frigid. There's two things I know about life: one, Americans will never take to soccer. Two, Swedish girls and stewardesses love to shag!  They're shag-mad, man! Let me ask you a question, Vanessa, and be honest.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Do I make you horny?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Do I make you horny? Randy, you know. To you, am I eros manifest?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I hope this is part of the unfreezing process.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Listen, Vanessa, I'm a swinger... That's what I do, I swing.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I understand that, Mr. Powers, but let me be perfectly clear with you, perhaps to the point of being insulting. I will never have sex with you, ever.  If you were the last man on Earth and I was the last woman on Earth, and the future of the human race depended on our having sex simply for procreation, I still would not have sex with you.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: You've preserved my Jag! Smashing!

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Yes, we've had it retrofitted with a secure cellular phone, an on-board computer, and a Global Geosynchronous Positioning Device. Oh, and finally, this.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Let me guess. The floss is garotte wire, the toothpaste contains plastic explosives, and the toothbrush is the detonation device.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: No, actually. I don't know how to put this really. Well, there have been fabulous advances in the field of dentistry.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Why? What's wrong with my teeth?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Hey, who put this in here? Someone's playing a prank on me!  Honestly, this isn't mine.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'm sure.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I think I'll give that stew a ding-a- ling.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I love Las Vegas, man. Oh, I forgot my x-ray glasses.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Here, use mine.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I'm going to use a cover name. It's important that it be a generic name so that we don't draw attention to ourselves.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I can't see a bloody thing.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh, I forgot to tell you, they're prescription X-ray glasses. I have very bad astigmatism.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Why did you leave so soon?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: That cat Number Two has an X-ray eyepatch. I get bad vibes from him, man. Listen, we should go back to the room, but first I have to go to the naughty chair and see a man about a dog.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Good morning, luv, who are you on the phone with?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Do you want to talk to him?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Good morning, Vanessa! I hope you have on clean underwear.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: We've got a doctor's appointment-- an evil doctor's appointment.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: A limousine has just pulled up.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Let me see.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Hello, hello. That's Dr. Evil's cat.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I never forget a pussy... cat.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Let's go get him!

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: He's too well-protected right now.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: We can't just sit here, Austin.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Let me tell you a story. There's these two bulls on top of a hill checking out some foxy cows in the meadow below. The young bull says, 'hey, why don't we run down the hill and shag us a cow?', and the wise old bull replies, 'no, why don't we walk down the hill and shag all the cows?'

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Well, you know... cows, and shagging.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Unfortunately, while you told that stupid story, Dr. Evil has escaped.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: No worries, luv. We'll just give Basil a tinkle on the telling bone...

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I hate having my picture taken.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: You're crazy. The camera loves you, Vanessa.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Fancy a nibble?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I couldn't have another bite.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Watch out, you're on my hair!

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Sorry. Move your hand to the left. There you go. Gorgeous.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Go! Just go!

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I haven't had fun like that since college.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I'm sorry that bug up your ass had to die.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Always wanting to have fun, that's you in a nutshell.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: No, this is me in a nutshell.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: You're smashed, Vanessa.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I am not.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Oh, yes you are.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'm not. I'm the sensible one. I'm always the designated driver.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I can't. You're drunk.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: It's not that I'm drunk, I'm just beginning to see what my Mum was talking about.  What was my mother like back in the Sixties? I'm dying to know.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: She was very groovy. She was so in love with your Dad. If there was one other cat in this world that could have loved your Mum and treated her as well as you Dad did, it was me. But, unfortunately for yours truly, that train has sailed.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Really, Austin!

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Look at her hands, baby! Those are carpenter's hands.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Austin, may I have a word with you?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Of course, luv.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Listen, I know I'm just being neurotic, but I can't shake this suspicious feeling about that Italian secretary, Ms. Fagina. I mean, I don't want to sound paranoid, but I've had some bad relationships in the past, and I have some jealousy issues. You went to her penthouse. It makes me feel so small to give into these insecurities, but I can't help but feel this weird, irrational, unfocused... well, jealousy. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Don't be sorry. You're right to be suspicious. I shagged her. I shagged her rotten.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I can't believe you made love to her just like that. Did you use protection?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Of course, I had my nine-millimeter automatic.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: No, did you use a condom?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Only sailors use condoms, man.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Not in the Nineties.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Well they should, filthy beggars, they go from port to port.  Alotta meant nothing to me.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Well, it means something to me. If you want us to have a relationship, you've got to be a one-woman man.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: It was just a shag, Vanessa. You're everything to me.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You just don't get it, do you, Austin? Good night. Welcome to the Nineties, you're going to be very lonely.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Hello, luv.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Thirty years of political and social upheaval. The fall of the Berlin wall, a female Prime Minister of England, the abolishment of Apartheid, a fascinating tapestry of human strum und drang.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Yeah, I can't believe Liberace was gay. Women loved him, man. I didn't see that one coming.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Basil was very concerned to know where you were last night.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Out and about, doing odds and sods.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'll tell him. By the way, I've decided we should keep our relationship strictly professional.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Since I've been unfrozen, I've had a rancid taste in my mouth. Do you have a piece of gum?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Do you think she's prettier than I?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You know who.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: No! Don't lay your hang-ups on me, Vanessa. You're being very trippy.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'm looking at you, and the whole time I can't help thinking you had your willie inside her hootchie-kooch.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Austin, we don't look anything like our photo badges.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Don't worry, baby. I picked up a mind control technique during my travels to India. I learned it from my guru, the late Guru Shastri, a chaste man who mysteriously died of a disease that had all the hallmarks of syphilis.  Just watch me. Watch me, now.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Thank God, Austin, we made it.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Yes, act naturally and we'll split this scene the way we came in, Vanessa.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Does that make you horny?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Not now, Austin.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: First, I plan to soil myself. Then, I plan to regroup and think about the next move. Any thoughts?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Sadly, no. Hold on! I always keep this on me just in case.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: All right, I get it. I have bad teeth. You have to understand, in Britain in the Sixties you could be a sex symbol and still have bad teeth. It didn't matter.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: No, no, no. We'll use the floss to get to the ledge.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Smashing idea! Give it to me.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Not a good time to lose one's head.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Indeed.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: That's not the way to get ahead in life.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: It's a shame he wasn't more headstrong.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Fair enough.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What do we do now?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: We've got a freaked out square and world annihilation is his bag.  You go get help. I'm gonna stay here and keep an eye on the bad Doctor.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'm not going anywhere. We're a team.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Too right, youth. That's why I need you to lead the troops.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'll hurry back.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Listen, Vanessa, whatever happens, I just want you to know that I feel bad about shagging that Italian girl. I had a sip of sake and all of the sudden, I don't know what happened. The whole time I was shagging her-- I mean really shagging her, I mean it was crazy, I was like a huge mechanical piston, in and out, IN and OUT!--

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Austin, what's your point?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Anyways, what I'm trying to say is that if you want me to be a one-woman man, well, that's just groovy, because... I love you.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh, behave!

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: It's not what it looks like, Vanessa.  At ease, boys.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Likewise.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I can explain. They attacked me. Gas came out of her...well, and then they... and I...

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I believe you, Austin. Let's go.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Hold on a tick, let me put on my togs.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Follow me! We're going to have to jump over the rail!

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Don't worry!

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Austin, I'm coming with you.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I'm going it alone this time, Vanessa. I have a follow-up visit with the Evil Doctor.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'll secure the perimeter.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I have something to tell you.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Lay it on me.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I love you, Austin.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: That's fab, because I love you, too, Vanessa.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Kiss me.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Behave!

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Danger Powers, personal effects.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Actually, my name's Austin Powers.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: It says here, name Danger Powers.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Danger's my middle name.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: OK, Austin Danger Powers: One blue crushed-velvet suit. One frilly lace cravat. One gold medallion with peace symbol. One pair of Italian shoes. One pair of tie-dyed socks, purple. One vinyl recording album: Tom Jones, Live at Las Vegas. One Swedish-made penis enlarger pump.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: That's not mine.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: One credit card receipt for Swedish- made penis enlarger pump, signed Austin Powers.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I'm telling you, baby, that's not mine.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: One warranty card for Swedish-made penis enlarger pump, filled out by Austin Powers.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I don't even know what this is. This sort of thing ain't my bag, baby.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: One book: Swedish-Made Penis Enlarger Pumps and Me: This Sort of Thing Is My Bag, Baby, by Austin Powers.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Hi, folks. You're entering a restricted zone. Can I see your security badges?

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Everything seems to be in order.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Hey, wait a minute--

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Here, have a piece of gum.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Here, have a piece of gum.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Don't mind if I do.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Hey! Wait a minute, that's my last piece of gum.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: No, no, I want you to have it, even if it's my last piece.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: No, no, I want you to have it, even if it's my last piece.

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: I'm going to go across the street and get you some sherbert.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Noooooooooooooo!

turns.speaker: AUSTIN
turns.text: Where did you learn to shoot?

turns.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
turns.text: Commander, this is Slater in SoWest Com Three. We have a potential bogey with erratic vectoring and an unorthodox entry angle.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER GILMOUR
turns.text: Is it one of ours?

turns.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
turns.text: No. Log Com Bird Twelve says its metalurg recon analysis is a standard alloy, not stealthy, not carbon- composite.  It does have an odd shape, sir.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER GILMOUR
turns.text: What are you saying, son?

turns.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
turns.text: It appears to be in the shape of Bob's Big Boy, sir.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER GILMOUR
turns.text: Oh my God, he's back.

turns.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
turns.text: In many ways, Bob's Big Boy never left, sir. He's always offered the same high quality meals at competitive prices.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER GILMOUR
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
turns.text: Should we scramble TacHQ for an intercept?

turns.speaker: COMMANDER GILMOUR
turns.text: What's its current position?

turns.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
turns.text: Commander, I have to log it...

turns.speaker: COMMANDER GILMOUR
turns.text: That's a direct order. You didn't see a thing!

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: But my design was perfect!  Your autonomic functions were shut down, and even though your arm wasn't frozen, the aging was retarded, therefore your right arm is only slightly older than the left.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Can't you see I'm only half a man? Look at me, I'm a freak!

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: But Dr. Evil, all you need to do is--  --work with this tennis ball. Squeeze it for twenty minutes a day. A few months of that and it'll be just as strong as the other arm...

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: And look what you've done to Mr. Bigglesworth!

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: We could not anticipate feline complications due to the reanimation process&emdash;

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Silence!

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: Ahhhhhhhhh!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Let this be a reminder to you all that this organization will not tolerate failure.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: We've got a lot of work to do.

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: Someone help me! I'm still alive, only I'm very badly burned.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Some of you I know, some of you I'm meeting for the first time.

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: Hello up there! Anyone! Can someone call an ambulance? I'm in quite a lot of pain.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: You've all been gathered here to form my Evil Cabinet. Excuse me.

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: Ow! You shot me!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Right. Okay. Moving on.

turns.speaker: MUSTAFA
turns.text: You shot me right in the arm!  Why did--

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Remember when we froze your semen, you said that if it looked like you weren't coming back to try and make you a son so that a part of you would live forever?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Well, after a few years, we got sort of impatient. Dr. Evil, I want you to meet your son.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: My son?

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Yes.  Scott!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Austin Powers is getting too close. He must be neutralized. Any suggestions?

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Ya wohl-- I mean, yes wohl, Herr Doctor. I have created the ultimate weapon to defeat Austin Powers. Bring on the Fembots!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Breathtaking, Frau. These automated strumpets are the perfect bait for the degenerate Powers.

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: These are the latest word in android replicant technology.  Lethal, efficient, brutal. And no man can resist their charms. Send in the soldiers!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Quite impressive.

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Thank you, Herr Doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: I like to see girls of that caliber. By caliber, I mean both the barrel size of their guns and the high quality of their character... Forget it.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Release the sharks!  All the sharks have had laser beams attached to their heads. I figure every creature deserves a warm meal.

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Dr. Evil?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Yes, what is it? You're interrupting my moment of triumph.

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: It's about the sharks. Since you were frozen, they've been placed on the Endangered Species List. We tried to get some, but it will take months to clear up the red tape.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Right.  Mr. Powers, we're going to lower you in a tank of piranhas with laser beams attached to their heads.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: What is it now?

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Well, we experimented with lasers, but you would be surprised at how heavy they are. They actually outweighed the piranha themselves, and the fish, well, they sank to the bottom and died.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: I have one simple request-- sharks with friggin' laser beams attached to their heads, and it can't be done? Remind me again why I pay you people? What do we have?

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Sea bass.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: They're mutated sea bass.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Really? Are they ill-tempered?

turns.speaker: FRAU FARBISSINA
turns.text: Please allow me to demonstrate.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: That was great, Mr. Keon, Dave. Thank you. OK, group, we have two new member. Say hello to Scott and his father, Mr.... Ehville?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Evil, actually, Doctor Evil.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: No, the boy's right. I really am evil.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Don't be so hard on yourself. You're here, that's what's important. A journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Actually, the boy's quite astute. I am trying to kill him. My Evil Associates have cautioned against it, so here he is, unfortunately, alive.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: We've heard from Scott, now let's hear from you.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: The details of my life are quite inconsequential.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: That's not true, Doctor. Please, tell us about your childhood.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Hello, Scott. I'm your father, Dr. Evil.  I have a son! I have a son! Everyone, I have a son!  Someday, Scott, this will all be yours.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I haven't seen you my whole life and now you show up and want a relationship? I hate you!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: But Scott, who's going to take over the world when I die?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Not me.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: An evil vet?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: No. Maybe, like, work in a petting zoo or something.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: An evil petting zoo?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: You always do that!  Anyways, this is really hard, because, you know, my Dad is really evil.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Scott my boy, come here. How was your day?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Well, me and a buddy went to the video arcade in town and, like, they don't speak English right, and so my buddy gets into a fight, and he goes 'hey, quit hassling me cause I don't speak French or whatever', and the other guy goes something in Paris talk, and I go 'um, just back off' and he goes 'get out' and I go 'make me'.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Fascinating. What are your plans for this evening?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Thought I'd stay in. There's a good tittie movie on Skinemax.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: And that's how you want to live your life, is it?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Yeah. What?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Scott, I want you to meet Daddy's nemesis, Austin Powers.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Why are you feeding him? Why don't you just kill him?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: In due time.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: But what if he escapes? Why don't you just shoot him? What are you waiting for?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: I have a better idea. I'm going to put him in an easily-escapable situation involving an overly- elaborate and exotic death.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Why don't you just shoot him now? Here, I'll get a gun. We'll just shoot him. Bang! Dead. Done.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: One more peep out of you and you're grounded. Let's begin.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Fine. Whatever. Mutated, ill-tempered sea bass it is.  Come, let's return to dinner. Close the tank.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Aren't you going to watch them? They'll get away!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: No, we'll leave them alone and not actually witness them dying, and we'll just assume it all went to plan.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I have a gun in my room. Give me five seconds, I'll come back and blow their brains out.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: No, Scott. You just don't get it, do you?

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Come, everyone, let us repair to the main chamber. Project Vulcan is about to begin. Scott, are you coming?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I don't want to.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Don't you want to see what Daddy does for a living?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Blow me.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Show me.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Dad, we just made a breakthrough in group!

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: I had the group liquidated, you little shit. They were insolent.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I hate you! I hate you! I wish I was never artificially created in a lab.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Scott, don't say that...

turns.speaker: NUMBER TWO
turns.text: We also own the Franklin mint, which makes decorative hand-painted theme plates for collectors.  Some plates, like the Gone With The Wind series, have gone up in value as much as two-hundred and forty percent, but, as with any investment, there is some risk involved.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Gentlemen, I have a plan. It's called blackmail. The Royal Family of Britain are the wealthiest landowners in the world. Either the Royal Family pays us an exorbitant amount of money, or we make it look like Prince Charles, the heir to the throne, has had an affair outside of marriage and, therefore, they would have to divorce.

turns.speaker: NUMBER TWO
turns.text: Um, Dr. Evil, Prince Charles did have an affair. He admitted it, and they are now divorced, actually.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: People have to tell me these things. I've been frozen for thirty years, throw me a bone here.  OK, no problem. Here's my second plan. Back in the Sixties I had a weather changing machine that was in essence a sophisticated heat beam which we called a "laser."  Using this laser, we punch a hole in the protective layer around the Earth, which we scientists call the "Ozone Layer." Slowly but surely, ultraviolet rays would pour in, increasing the risk of skin cancer. That is, unless the world pays us a hefty ransom.

turns.speaker: NUMBER TWO
turns.text: Umm, that also has already happened.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Right.  Oh, hell, let's just do what we always do. Let's hijack some nuclear weapons and hold the world hostage.  Gentlemen, it's come to my attention that a breakaway Russian Republic called Kreplachistan will be transferring a nuclear warhead to the United Nations in a few days. Here's the plan. We get the warhead, and we hold the world ransom...  ...FOR ONE MILLION DOLLARS!

turns.speaker: NUMBER TWO
turns.text: Don't you think we should ask for more than a million dollars? A million dollars isn't that much money these days.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: All right then...  ...FIVE MILLION DOLLARS!

turns.speaker: NUMBER TWO
turns.text: Virtucon alone makes over nine billion dollars a year.

turns.speaker: DR. EVIL
turns.text: Oh, really?  One-hundred billion dollars.  OK, make it happen. Anything else?

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: Oh, hello Vanessa. How was the flight?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: How's Austin?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: He's asleep.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: You didn't...

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh, God no, I made him sleep on the couch.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: I'm proud of you.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: Because you managed to resist Austin Power's charms.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Well, God knows he tried, but I've been rather firm with him, Mummy. You didn't tell me he was so obsessed with sex. It's bizarre.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: You can't judge him by modern standards. He's very much a product of his times. In my day he could have any woman he wanted.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What about his teeth?

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: You have to understand, in Britain in the Sixties you could be a sex symbol and still have bad teeth. It didn't matter.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I just don't see it.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: Just wait. Once Austin gets you in his charms, it's impossible to get out.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Did you ever...

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: Of course not. I was married to your father.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Did you ever want to?

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: Austin is very charming, very debonair. He's handsome, witty, has a knowledge of fine wines, sophisticated, a world-renowned photographer. Women want him, men want to be him. He's a lover of love-- every bit an International Man of Mystery.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You didn't answer my question, Mum.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: I know. Let me just say this: Austin was the most loyal and caring friend I ever had.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: No, it's been too long. Best to leave things alone.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'm on with a friend!  Look, I'd better go. I love you.

turns.speaker: MRS. KENSINGTON
turns.text: I love you, Vanessa.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: So, Scott, why don't we start with you. Why are you here?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: Well, it's kind of weird.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: We don't judge here.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: OK. Well, I just really met my Dad for the first time three days ago. He was partially frozen for thirty years. I never knew him growing up. He comes back and now he wants me to take over the family business.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: And how do you feel about that?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I don't wanna take over the family business.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: What do you want to do, Scott?

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I don't know. I was thinking, maybe I'd be a vet or something, cause I like animals and stuff.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: We don't label people here, Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: No, he's really evil.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTT EVIL
turns.text: I just think, like, he hates me. I really think he wants to kill me.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: OK, Scott, no one really wants to "kill" anyone here. They say it, but they don't mean it.

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: We're not yet open for business, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Shame. I was recommended. By a friend.

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Sir August Merryweather? I was looking for something relaxing. Say, a Tuscan hillside in June?

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Normally, we'd be eager to oblige --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Seriously?

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: Of course. Natural weather delivered to your door on demand. Down your phoneline. For limited periods.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You don't say. How real does it feel?

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: As real as you wish. Hot or cold. Humid or dry. Anything you like. Within reason.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: There are limits?

turns.speaker: BAILEY
turns.text: The technology is brand new. Soon it will be more powerful. We anticipate a huge demand. Leave us your number. We'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: No need. I'll call again.

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: I want you to say the first thing that comes into your head when I say these words. Do you understand ... ?  Blue ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... bottle ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Red ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... head ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Knight ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Black...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... death ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Love...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... death ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Flower ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... power ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Nature ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... preserve...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Secret ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... love...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Hope...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... love ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Fear ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... love ...

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Peter ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: How long have I been here?

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Three days.

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: He said if it vanished, he'd know it was ... you who betrayed him. He took a huge risk. The ultimate test.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: So I'm still ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Would that I could say the Same.

turns.speaker: DR. DARLING
turns.text: Ah, but you haven't see the real me. Watch closely ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I've come to apply for membership in Brolly --

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: You don't get rain like you used to in England. A good shower that's the ticket. Stiffens resolve, puckers the spirit, quells the namby-pamby in a man.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I so agree. How did you acquire a taste for it?

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: Out in India. So character-forming for the British. Not the heat. Good Lord, no. The rain, dash it. A good monsoon. Fifteen inches overnight. A whole week of lovely rain. I remember one summer in Jaipur ...

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: You

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Have we met?

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: You mean you don't recall??

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: Ah, beautiful. Just as he promised.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Promised? Who promised?

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: There, look!

turns.speaker: SIR AUGUST
turns.text: Mrs. Peel ... Come quickly. Brolly's been betrayed! I'll tell you everything ... The weather's getting worse and worse ... they're after me ... coming for me ... come quickly!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Sir August...?  What now?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: May I help you, madam ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Mr. John Steed, please.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: I'm afraid that's impossible.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Impossible?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: You are female?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: As you see.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Then you can't come in.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I have an appointment.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: No women. Not in Boodles. Not since 1922.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Really -- what happened in 1922?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Sir August ... ? Sir August ... ?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Eh? In here!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Quite a collection.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: If nature gives a man a collector's mind, it doesn't matter what he collects. Butterflies. Old China. Penny farthings. A true collector grows more obsessive as the years pass.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Your voice -- it's so familiar ...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: We have met ...

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Congratulations, Mrs. Peel. You have been a worthy opponent. You have tracked us down. You are within an ace of winning.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: This isn't a game.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Quite right, but we still make the rules.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Rules are made to be broken.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: People, too.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Then who wins?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: You and I. Together. But first you must confront your greatest enemy. Who could that be, Mrs. Peel? The answer is obvious ...
